name: Find a Book
dialogue: Well, I'll find someone else to do it for me.

name: Follow Sarcophagus Team
dialogue: You wouldn't believe what I found...

Holy hell, the crash you recovered the black box from wasn't as old as I thought.  
Check this out, it was on its approach to pick up a team sent to secure and destroy something called a 
'Hazardous Waste Sarcophagus' in the middle of nowhere.  If the bird never picked up the team then we 
may still have a chance to meet up with them.  It includes an access code for the elevator and an encoded 
message for the team leader, I guess.  If we want to join up with what remains of the government then now 
may be our only chance.
Are you going to forfeit your duty when the country needs you the most?

If there is a military team down there then we better go in prepared if we want to 
impress them.  Carry as much ammo as you can and prepare to ditch this place if they have a second 
bird coming to pick them up.
Having any trouble following the map?
What?!  I out'ta whip your ass.

name: Clear Back Bay
dialogue:
If you really want to lend a hand we could use your help clearing out the dead 
in the back bay.  Fearful of going outside during the first days of the cataclysm 
we ended up throwing our dead and the zombies we managed to kill in the sealed 
back bay.  Our promising leader at the time even fell... he turned into something 
different.  Kill all of them and make sure they won't bother us again.  We can't 
pay much but it would help us to reclaim the bay.
Please be careful, we don't need any more deaths.
Come back when you get a chance, we really need to start reclaiming the region.
If you can, get a friend or two to help you.
Will they be bothering us any longer?
Thank you, having that big of a threat close to home was nerve wrecking.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Missing Caravan
dialogue:
This is a bit more involved than the last request, we recently lost a 
scavenger party coming to trade with us and would like you to 
investigate.  We strongly suspect a raider band or horde caught them 
off-guard. I can give you the coordinates of their last radio message 
but little else.  In either case, deal with the threat so that the 
scavengers can continue to pass through in relative safety.  The best 
reward I can offer is a claim to the supplies they were carrying.
Our community survives on trade, we appreciate it.
Come back when you get a chance, we really need to start reclaiming the region.
If you can, get a friend or two to help you.

Thank you, the world is a better place without them.  Two of our more skilled 
individuals accepted the assistance of the Old Guard in setting up an outpost 
while you were out.  We didn't have many other options, refugees are still 
streaming in and we don't know what else to do with our limited food supply.  
If you get a chance, you should see if they need your assistance in the future...
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Retrieve Prospectus
dialogue:
The new outpost that we've started could use your assistance.  I need you to get the 
foreman's prospectus before we begin to send additional refugees to the farming commune.  
Consult with the foreman to get more detailed tasks.
I'm sure the outpost will expand quickly with your assistance.
Come back when you get a chance, we really need to start reclaiming the region.
With this we'll be able to convince others to invest in the commune.  Thank you.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 25 Plutonium Cells
dialogue:
We are starting to build new infrastructure here and would like to get a few 
new electrical systems online... unfortunately our existing system relies on 
an array of something called RTGs.  From what I understand they work like 
giant batteries of sorts.  We can expand our power system but to do so we 
would need enough plutonium.  With 25 plutonium cells we would be 
able to get an electrical expansion working for a year or two.  I know they 
are rare but running generators isn't a viable option in the basement.
If you can do this for us our survival options would vastly increase.
Come back when you get a chance, we really need to start reclaiming the region.
Can't help you much, I've never even seen a plutonium battery.
Great, I know it isn't much but we hope to continue to expand thanks to your help.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find Antibiotics
dialogue: I'm infected.  Badly.  I need you to get some antibiotics for me...

Oh, thank god, thank you so much!  I won't last more than a couple of days, 
so hurry...
There's a town nearby.  Check pharmacies; it'll be behind the counter.
Oh thank god!  I'll be right as rain in no time.
What?!  You're lying, I can tell!  Ugh, forget it!
How am I not dead already?!

name: Retrieve Military Black Box
dialogue: We've got the flag, now we need to locate US forces.

We have the flag but now we need to locate US troops to see
 what we can do to help.  I haven't seen any but I'm figure'n one of
 those choppers that were fly'n round during th outbreak would have a good
 idea.  If you can get me a black box from one of the wrecks I'll look
 into where we might open'er at.
Do you have any better ideas?

Survivors were talking about them crashing but I don't know
 where.  If I were a pilot I'd avoid crash landing in a city or forest
 though.
What?!  I out'ta whip you're ass.
Damn, I'll have to find'er myself.

name: Retrieve Black Box Transcript
dialogue: With the black box in hand, we need to find a lab.

Thanks to your searching we've got the black box but now we
 need to have a look'n-side her.  Now, most buildings don't have power
 anymore but there are a few that might be of use.  Have you ever seen
 one of those science labs that have popped up in the middle of nowhere?
 Them suckers have a glowing terminal out front so I know they have power
 somewhere inside'em.  If you can get inside and find a computer lab that
 still works you ought to be able to find out what's in the black box.
Do you have any better ideas?

When I was play'n with the terminal for the one I ran into it
 kept asking for an ID card.  Finding one would be the first order of business.

America, fuck ya!  I was in the guard a few years back so I'm
 confident I can make heads-or-tails of these transmissions.
What?!  I out'ta whip you're ass.
Damn, I maybe we can find an egg-head to crack the terminal.

name: Find Deputy Badge
dialogue:
I hope you will find use from what you got out of the deposit box but I also have another job for you 
that might lead you to an opportunity to deal out justice for those who cannot.  First things first, we can't just 
look like ruffians.  Find us a deputy badge, easy enough?
We're also official... just hang in there and I'll show you what we can really do.
They shouldn't be that hard to find... should they?
Great work, Deputy.  We're in business.
The day of reckoning will come for the criminals if it hasn't already.

name: Find Flag
dialogue: Does our flag still yet wave?

Does our flag still yet wave? We're battered but not yet out of the
 fight, we need the old colors!
Hell ya!  Find me one of those big ol' American flags.
Find a large federal building or school, they must have one.

You give up?  This country fell apart because no one could find a
good man to rely on... might as well give up, I guess.

name: Find Corporate Accounts
dialogue:
Our world fell apart because our leaders were as crooked as the con-men that 
paid for their elections.  Just find me one of those corporate accounting books and I'll 
show you and the rest of the world just who is at fault.
You'll see, I know I'm right.

I know it isn't pressing but the big corporations didn't get a chance to destroy 
the evidence yet.
Try a big corporate building of some sort, they're bound to have an accounting department.

Great, let's see... uh... hmmm...  Fine, I didn't even do my own taxes but I'm sure this 
will prove their guilt if we get an expert to examine it.
The day of reckoning will come for the corporations if it hasn't already.

name: Find Patient Records
dialogue: I hope I don't see many names I know...

I've lost so many friends... please find me a patient list from the 
regional hospital or doctor's office.  I just want to know who might still be out there.
Thank you, I suppose it won't change what has already happened but it will bring me closure.
Please, I just want to know what happened to everyone.
I bet you'll run into a lot of those things in the hospital, please be careful.
Oh dear, I thought Timmy would have made it...
I bet some of them are still out there...

name: Find Weather Log
dialogue: I wonder if a retreat might exist...

Everyone who dies gets back up, right?  Which means that whatever 
is causing this it must be airborne to have infected everyone.  I believe that 
if that is the case then there should be regions that were not downwind from 
where-ever the disease was released.  We need to find a record of all the 
weather patterns leading up to the outbreak.
Thanks so much, you may save both of us yet.
Ya, it was a long shot I admit.
I'm not sure, maybe a news station would have what we are looking?
These look more complicated than I thought, just give me some time.
If only we could find a great valley or something.

name: Find Relic
dialogue: St. Michael the archangel defend me in battle...

As the world seems to abandon the reality that we once knew, it 
becomes plausible that the old superstitions that were cast aside may 
have had some truth to them.  Please go and find me a religious relic...
I doubt it will be of much use but I've got to hope in something.
I wish you the best of luck, may whatever god you please guide your path.
Ya, I guess the stress may just be getting to me...
I suppose a large church or cathedral may have something.
Any luck? Please find me a small relic. Any relic will do.
Thank you, I need some time alone now...
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Retrieve Deposit Box
dialogue:
Now I don't mean to upset you but I'm not sure what I can do with the accounting ledger at the 
moment.  We do have a new lead though, the ledger has a safe deposit box under the regional manager's name.  
Guess what, dumb sucker wrote down his combination.  Come with me to retrieve the box and you can keep any 
of the goodies in it that I can't use to press charges against these bastards.
You may make a tidy profit from this.

I know it isn't pressing but the world is going to be just as corrupt when we start rebuilding unless 
we take measure to stop those who seek to rule over us.
This shouldn't be hard unless we run into a horde.
Great, anything I can't use to prosecute the bastards is yours, as promised.
The day of reckoning will come for the corporations if it hasn't already.

name: Retrieve Software
dialogue: Oh man, I can't believe I forgot to download it...
There's some important software on my computer that I need on USB.
Thanks!  Just pull the data onto this USB drive and bring it to me.
Take this USB drive.  Use the console, and download the software.
So, do you have my software yet?
Wow, you failed?  All that work, down the drain...

name: Analyze Zombie Blood
dialogue: It could be very informative to perform an analysis of zombie blood...

I need someone to get a sample of zombie blood, take it to a hospital, and 
perform a centrifuge analysis of it.

Excellent.  Take this vacutainer; once you've produced a zombie corpse, use it 
to extract blood from the body, then take it to a hospital for analysis.
Are you sure?  The scientific value of that blood data could be priceless...

The centrifuge is a bit technical; you might want to study up on the usage of 
computers before completing that part.
Well, do you have the data yet?
Excellent!  This may be the key to removing the infection.
Wait, you couldn't possibly have the data!  Liar!
What a shame, that data could have proved invaluable...

name: Investigate Cult
dialogue: St. Michael the archangel defend me in battle...

You have no idea how interesting this diary is.  I have two 
very promising leads...  First things first, the Catholic Church has been 
performing its own investigations into global cult phenomenon and it appears 
to have become very interested in a local cult as of recently.  Could you investigate 
a location for me?  I'm not sure what was going on here but the priest seemed 
fairly worried about it.

I wish you the best of luck, may whatever god you please guide your path...  You may need it 
this time more than the past excursions you have gone on.  There is a note about potential human 
sacrifice in the days immediately before and after the outbreak.  The name of the cult is believed 
to be the Church of Starry Wisdom but it is noted that accounts differ.
Ya, I guess the stress may just be getting to me...

I doubt the site is still occupied but I'd carry a firearm at least... I'm not sure what 
you might be looking for but I'm positive you'll find something out of the ordinary if you look long 
enough.
I'm positive there is something there... there has to be, any luck?

Thank you, your account of these... demonic creations proves the fears the churches 
had were well founded.  Our priority should be routing out any survivors of this cult... I don't 
known if they are responsible for the outbreak but they certainly know more about it than I do.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Prison Visionary
dialogue: St. Michael the archangel defend me in battle...

I have another task if you are feeling up to it.  There is a prisoner that 
the priest made special mention of.  I was wondering if you could see 
what may have happened to him or if he left anything in his cell.  The priest admits the individual is rather 
unstable, to put it lightly, but the priest personally believed the man was some kind of repentant visionary.  I'm 
not in a position to cast out the account just yet... it seems the man has prophesied  events accurately before 
concerning the Church of Starry Wisdom.

I wish you the best of luck, may whatever god you please guide your path...  I can only imagine that the prison 
will be a little slice of hell.  I'm not sure what they would have decided to do with the inmates when they knew 
death was almost certain.
Ya, I guess the stress may just be getting to me...

The worst case scenario will probably be that the prisoners have escaped their cells and turned the 
building into their own little fortress.  Best case, the building went into lock-down and secured the prisoners in 
their cells.  Either way, navigating the building will pose its own difficulties.
Thank you, I'm not sure what to make of this but I'll ponder your account.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Tracker
dialogue: Well damn, you must be the guys here to pick me up...

I got the brief so I know what I'm getting into.  Let me be upfront, 
treat me like shit and I'm going to cover my own hide.  Without a strong band a man doesn't 
stand a chance in this world.  You ready to take charge boss?
Before we get into a major fight just make sure we have the gear we need, boss.
I don't think you're going to find many other survivors who haven't taken up a faction yet.
I'm a pretty good shot with a rifle or pistol.
Wait... are you really making me a deputy?

name: Kill 100 Zombies
dialogue: You seem to know this new world better than most...

You're kitted out better than most... would you be interested in making this world a 
little better for the rest of us?  The towns have enough supplies for us survivors to 
start securing a foothold but we don't have anyone with the skills and equipment to thin the masses 
of undead.  I'll lend you a hand to the best of my ability but you really 
showed promise taking out that other beast.  You, I, and a 100 regular zombies laid to rest, what do you say?
Hell ya, we may get ourselves killed but we'll be among the first legends of the apocalypse.

Hey, I know I wouldn't volunteer for it either... but then I remember that most of us survivors 
won't make it unless someone decides to take the initiative.
I'd secure an ammo cache and try to sweep a town in multiple passes.

Man... you're a goddamn machine.  It was a pleasure working with you.  You know, you may just change 
our little neck of the world if you keep this up.
I don't think that was quite a hundred dead zeds.

name: Kill Horde Master
dialogue: I've heard some bad rumors so I hope you are up for another challenge...

Apparently one of the other survivors picked up on an unusually dense horde of undead 
moving into the area.  At the center of this throng there was a 'leader' of some sort.  The short of it is, 
kill the son of a bitch.  We don't know what it is capable of or why it is surrounded by other zombies but 
this thing reeks of trouble.  Do whatever it takes but we can't risk it getting away.
I'll lend you a hand but I'd try and recruit another gunslinger if you can.
What's the use of walking away, they'll track you down eventually.

Don't risk torching the building it may be hiding in if it has a basement.  The sucker may still be 
alive under the rubble and ash.
May that bastard never get up again.
I don't think we got it yet.

name: Kill Jabberwock
dialogue: The eater of the dead... something was ripping zombies to shreds and only leaving a few scattered limbs...

A few days ago another survivor and I were trying to avoid the cities by staying in the woods 
during the day and foraging for gear at night. It worked well against the normal zed's but one night something 
caught onto our trail and chased us for ten minutes or so until we decided to split up and meet-up back here.  My 
buddy never showed up and I don't have the means to kill whatever it was.  Can you lend a hand?
Thanks, make sure you're ready for whatever the beast is.
Hey, I know I wouldn't volunteer for it either.
I'd carry a shotgun at least, it sounded pretty big.
You look a little shaken up, I can't tell you how glad I am that you killed it though.
Something in the shadows still seems to stare at me when I look at the woods.
I'm glad you came back alive... I wasn't sure if I had sent you to your death.

name: Kill Zombie Mom
dialogue: Oh god, I can't believe it happened...

My mom... she's... she was killed, but then she just got back up... she's one 
of those things now.  Can you put her out of her misery for me?
Thank you... she would've wanted it this way.
Please reconsider, I know she's suffering...
Find a gun if you can, make it quick...
Well...?  Did you... finish things for my mom?
Thank you.  I couldn't rest until I knew that was finished.
What?!  You're lying, I can tell!  Ugh, forget it!

name: Null mission
dialogue: YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG

name: Locate Commo Team
dialogue:
My communications team went to secure the radio control room after we 
breached the facility.  I haven't heard from them since, I need you to 
locate them.  Their first objective was to record all active channels that 
were transmitting information on other survivors or facilities.  Find them 
and return the frequency list to me.  I'm sure they could probably use your 
help also.
Good luck, the communications room shouldn't be far from here.

I don't know why you would bother wasting your time down here if you can't 
handle a few small tasks...
We were briefed that the communications array was on this level.
Thanks, let me know when you need another tasking.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Cull Nightmares
dialogue:
Your assistance is greatly appreciated, we need to clear out the more 
ruthless monsters that are wandering up from the lower levels.  If you 
could cull twenty or so of what we refer to as 'nightmares' my men 
would be much safer.  If you've cleared out most of this floor then the 
lower levels should be your next target.
Good luck, finding a clear passage to the second level may be tricky.

I don't know why you would bother wasting your time down here if you can't 
handle a few small tasks...
These creatures can swing their appendages surprisingly far.
Thanks, let me know when you need another tasking.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Fabricate Repeater Mod
dialogue:
My chief responsibility is to monitor radio traffic and locate potential targets to 
secure or rescue.  The majority of radio repeaters are down and those that are working 
have only emergency power.  If you have a basic understanding of electronics you should 
be able to fabricate  the 'radio repeater mod' found in these plans.  When this mod is 
attached to a radio station's main terminal, all short range radio traffic on emergency 
channels is boosted so we can pick it up at much longer ranges.  I really need you make 
me one.
Thanks, I know the labs on the other side of the complex have electronic parts sitting around.

I don't know why you would bother wasting your time down here if you can't 
handle a few small tasks...
I'm sure the motorpool has a truck battery you could salvage.
Have you had any luck fabricating it?

Thanks, I'll see to installing this one.  It will be some time but I could use someone to position 
these around the region.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Disable External Power
dialogue:
I guess I could use your skills once again.  There are small transmitters located in the nearby evacuation 
shelters; if we don't separate them from the power grid their power systems will rapidly deteriorate 
over the next few weeks.  The task is rather simple but the shelters offer us a place to redirect refugees 
until this vault can be secured.
Thanks, I should be ready for you to install the radio repeater mods by the time you get back.

I don't know why you would bother wasting your time down here if you can't 
handle a few small tasks...
Try searching on the outskirts of towns.
Have you had any luck severing the connection?
We are good to go!  The last of the gear is powering up now.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Install Repeater Mod
dialogue:
Most of my essential gear has been brought back online so it is time for you to install your 
first radio repeater mod.  Head topside and locate the nearest radio station.  Install the 
mod on the backup terminal and return to me so that I can verify that everything was successful.  
Radio towers must unfortunatly be ignored for now, without a dedicated emergency power system 
they won't be useful for some time.
I'll be standing by down here once you are done.

I don't know why you would bother wasting your time down here if you can't 
handle a few small tasks...
If you could make some sort of directional antenna, it might help locating the radio stations.
Have you had any luck finding a radio tower?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Install Repeater Mod
dialogue:
I could always use you to put another repeater mod up.  I don't have to remind you but every 
one that goes up extends our response area just a little bit more.  With enough of them we'll 
be able to maintain communication with anyone in the region.

I don't know why you would bother wasting your time down here if you can't 
handle a few small tasks...
Getting a working vehicle is going to become important as the distance you have to travel increases.
Have you had any luck finding a radio tower?
I'll try and update the captain with any signals that I need investigated.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Kill Bandits
dialogue:
I don't like sending untested men into the field but if you have stayed alive so far 
you might have some skills.  There are at least a pair of bandits squatting in a local cabin, 
anyone who preys upon civilians meets a quick end... execute both of them for their 
crimes.  Complete this and the Old Guard will consider you an asset in the region.
The States will remain a wasteland unless good men choose to save it.
They might suspect you are coming, keep an eye out for traps.
The Old Guard thanks you for eliminating the criminals.  You won't be forgotten.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Deal with Informant
dialogue:
This task is going to require a little more persuasive skill.  I believe the 
Hell's Raiders have an informant here to monitor who comes and goes.  I need 
you to find out who it is and deal with them without letting anyone else know 
of my suspicions.  We normally allow the Free Merchants to govern themselves 
so I would hate to offend them.
Thank you, please keep this discreet.
Come back when you get a chance, we could use a few good men.
If they draw first blood their friends are less likely to blame you...
Thank you, I'll do the explaining if anyone else asks about it.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Kill ???
dialogue:
There is another monster troubling the merchants but this time it isn't 
human... at least I don't think.  Guy just disappeared while walking 
behind a packed caravan.  They didn't hear any shots but I suppose some 
raider may have been real sneaky.  Check out the area and report anything 
you find.
Thanks, keeping the people safe is what we try and do.
Come back when you get a chance, we really need to start reclaiming the region.

Search the bushes for any trace?  I'm not an expert tracker but you should 
be able to find something.
Great work, wasn't sure what I was sending you after.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Kill Raider Leader
dialogue:
I've located a Hell's Raiders encampment in the region that appears to be 
coordinating operations against the Free Merchants.  We know almost nothing 
about the command structure in the 'gang' so I need to send someone in to 
decapitate the leadership.  The raid will be held under orders of the U.S. 
Marshals Service and by agreeing to the mission you will become a marshal, 
swearing to assist the federal government in regaining order.

Now repeat after me...
I do solemnly swear that I will support and defend the Constitution of the 
United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic...
...that I will bear true faith and allegiance to the same...
...that I take this obligation freely, without any mental reservation or purpose of evasion...
...and that I will well and faithfully discharge the duties of the office on which I am about to enter.
To establish justice, insure domestic tranquility, provide for the common defense, promote the 
general welfare and secure the blessings of liberty.
So help me God.
Congratulations Marshal, don't forget your badge and gun.  As a marshal all men or women assisting you are 
considered deputy marshals so keep them in line.
Come back when you get a chance, we could use a few good men.

I'd recommend having two deputies... it would be a death trap if a 
single man got surrounded.
Has the leadership been dealt with?

Marshal, you continue to impress us.
If you are interested, I recently received a message that a unit was deploying into our AO.
I don't have the exact coordinates but they said they were securing an underground facility and may require assistance.
The bird dropped them off next to a pump station.  Can't tell you much more.
If you cound locate the captain in charge, I'm sure he could use your skills. 
Don't forget to wear your badge when meeting with them.
Thank you once again marshal.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Make 2 Stills
dialogue:
The wine and beer we can brew are sufficient to attract most patrons but we need something 
a bit stronger to get them to forget their misery.  Could you build me a pair of stills?
This should let us start producing whiskey, rum, and brandy when we get access to the ingredients.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
I'm sure you could find the design for the stills in home brewing books.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 20 Yeast
dialogue:
The last batch that I brewed was terrible, I'm fairly sure something contaminated the yeast 
we have been using.  Could you locate a source of fresh yeast for us to use?  I'd need about 20 
teaspoons of dry yeast to get started.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Yeast should be common in homes or bakeries.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 10 Sugar Beet Seeds
dialogue:
Sugar and molasses remains in short supply.  I've put in a request for more but it is unlikely 
that I'm going to see a reliable source for some time.  If you are interested, we are going to 
need sugar beet seeds to meet future demand regardless of what the scavengers can find.  Could 
you bring me at least enough seeds to plant a small 10 meter long patch?
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Farms or supply stories might have a few seeds...
Do you have the sugar beet seeds?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 12 Metal Tanks
dialogue:
The drinks we brew here have become a major draw for visitors and the occasional trader.  Our 
batches have become larger but we are still running out of storage space between trading runs.  
I've been able to get a few volunteers to help me build a set of standing tanks but I still need 
12 metal tanks to build them.  I've talked with the scrappers but we are a low priority at the 
moment.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Scrapping vehicles might be your best bet.
Do you have the metal tanks?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 2 55-Gallon Drums
dialogue:
The other survivor outposts that we have contact with have been more than eager to trade for 
beer or other drinks.  Transporting the drinks to them has presented a number of challenges 
though.  If you could locate a pair of 55-gallon drums we should be able to keep them 
supplied while turning a significant profit.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Factories or junk yards are the only places I know where to look.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Cut 200 2x4's
dialogue:
Our first project is to enclose the barn so that new refugees have a safe place 
to sleep.  Before we can begin serious improvements we need lumber to work with.  
Enclosing the four barn entrances will take nearly 400 2x4's... if you could 
provide half of that we should be able to take care of the other half and 
construction.  If you don't have a truck, I'd make finding one your first priority.
The more men we can bring to the camp the quicker improvements can be made.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Avoid destroying the furniture, we'll be needing it.
Great, I'll send word that we could use another set of hands or two to help out here.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Gather 6 First Aid Kits
dialogue:
We've started planning a medical clinic but we are going to need a lot more supplies if we hope to 
warrant sending one of the few people with medical experience from the refugee center to our 
outpost.  I know first aid kits are rare but they have all the basic supplies that I'm uncertain 
of.  If you could bring in 3 full kits I'm sure we could supplement them to make them last a bit 
longer.
We'll do our best to make them last...
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Homes, hospitals, labs, and doctor offices would be where I'd check.
Do you have the first aid kits?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 2 Electric Welders
dialogue:
The work you have done has swayed the leaders at the refugee center to send someone out to assist 
with our medical needs.  The next step is for us to get a sort of chop-shop setup so that we can 
begin using scrap metal to build fortifications and equipment.  We are going to need a pair of 
electric welders for our mechanics to use.
With two, we should be able to repair one if it breaks.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
The only place I've seen them is garages but I imagine you could find them in some stores.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 12 Car Batteries
dialogue:
We have the basic equipment that we need but without a functioning power grid we are forced to rely 
on the readily available vehicle batteries.  This is going to be a chore but I'll need twelve car 
batteries to swap between charging and powering our equipment.  The good news is that they don't need 
to be charged, we can take care of that.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Cars can be found in traffic jams along roads or in parking lots... I'm sure you can find a few.
Do you have the car batteries?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 2 Two-Way Radios
dialogue:
Check with the nurse when you get a chance, I know she will need help setting up our clinic.  On 
the construction front, we are going to need to get dedicated scavenger teams setup to bring in 
the miscellaneous supplies that we use in small quantities.  We are going to start setting up a 
junk shop for them in the North end of the outpost so we could use your help with that.  
Communication is the biggest obstacle for the teams... could you bring in a pair two two-way radios?
Organizing the scavenging missions is difficult enough without communication.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
You should be able to find them in electronics stores or at a police station.
Do you have the two-way radios?
I'm sure the scavengers will find these useful.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Gather 5 Backpacks
dialogue:
The volunteers for the scavenging teams will need to be issued some basic equipment.  When the boss 
sets up shop in the junk shed you should ask him what else he needs for his teams.  In the meantime 
we can provide a few backpacks to get them started.  Could you find five backpacks to give to the 
initial team?
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
It may be easier to make them if you can't find a school or something.
Having at least basic equipment greatly increases survivability.  Thanks.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find Homebrewer's Bible
dialogue:
Growth has lately begun to stall, we have individuals passing through the outpost but the prospect 
of hard labor just to eek out an existence is driving them away.  We've asked around and decided 
that, despite our pressing needs, building a bar ought to draw some of the less committed 
individuals to the outpost.  Unlike other settlements, the more hands we have to more food we can 
produce... at least in the long term.  Unfortunately, no one here has brewed alcoholic drinks 
before so we are going to need you to find a book called the 'Homebrewer's Bible' or something 
along those lines.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
I guess you should search homes or libraries?
I guarantee we will toast to your name when the bar is finished.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Gather 80 Sugar
dialogue:
Just flipping through the book I can tell that one ingredient in most of the alcoholic drinks 
that we don't have a large supply of is sugar.  What alcohol we have been able to loot isn't 
going to last us long so starting our first large batch is a priority.  Could you bring in 80 
units of sugar?  That should last us until we can start producing our own supply.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.

You might get lucky finding it but you could always boil it out of fruit if you are familiar 
with the process.
There is a large group of thirsty individuals in our outpost that are truly thankful for your work.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Collect 30 Glass Sheets
dialogue:
Although we are an agricultural outpost, we are restricted to growing plants that are compatible 
with the New England climate during the warmer months.  The easiest way to work around that is to 
build green houses to supplement our external fields.  There isn't going to be an easy way to 
build these, we are going to need a massive number of glass sheets to enclose the frames.  The 
first house will need 20 sheets of glass if you are still interested.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Deconstructing existing windows is the only way I know of to keep the sheets intact.
Do you have the glass sheets?
We'll begin planting our first seeds as soon as we can get these installed.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 25 Blankets
dialogue:
With the barn entrances enclosed the refugees moving into there should feel safer but the 
weather can be bitter here.  We're going to need to build makeshift beds in the stalls to 
ward off disease and frostbite.  We can take care of the frames but will need your help 
looting blankets.  We'd need 25 blankets to provide the most basic sleeping accommodations.
I'd start with looting hotels or you could sew them together... but that would be a last resort.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Avoid destroying the furniture here, we'll be needing it.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Gather 2500 Nails
dialogue:
Our supply of nails has been depleted.  I'm going to have to ask you to get us a few more 
boxes.  Hardware stores should have a few if they haven't been looted.  I suppose you may 
be able to find handfuls of them in building rubble.  We'd need 2500 to have enough that we 
won't be sending you back out too soon.

Deconstructing furniture isn't going to be efficient, try looking for boxes or grabbing any 
sitting on top of rubble piles.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Avoid destroying the furniture here, we'll be needing it.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Gather 300 Salt
dialogue:
I'm sure you've noticed the new workers that have started trickling in.  The Free Merchant 
counsel is demanding that we immediately begin projects to become self-sufficient due to 
limited supplies.  We are going to need to rapidly setup an agricultural industry before 
winter and starvation catches us unprepared and unsupported.  In order to get a half dozen 
shovels and a couple of bags of seeds, we are going to have to trade for it.  I've already 
got the deal lined up but the only thing they are willing to trade it for is salt.  I 
negotiated them down from 500 units to 300... we were hoping you might have access to a source.

Salt is key to preserving meat and other perishables... without any excess food it wouldn't 
do us much good now but I imagine we'll need to send you out to get more in the future.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
If you can find a source of salt water you should be able to boil it down.
We are going to begin preparing our fields immediately.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: 30 Liquid Fertilizer
dialogue:
Well, our first crop will be planted shortly but I'm starting to suspect that our profit 
margin is going to be much smaller than we expect.  With limited seed for our original crop 
our next course of action is to increase the soil's fertility.  Is there any way you could 
find or produce a basic liquid fertilizer for us?  We'd need at least 30 units to make a 
significant improvement in our output.

I don't know the exact recipie but I'm sure you could make it from a comercial fertilizer or 
produce it from bonemeal.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
I'd look through a few basic chemistry books to find a simple recipe.
Do you have the liquid fertilizer?
This really should make the first winter easier to survive.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Gather 75 Stones
dialogue:
Our current assessment for survivability has increased significantly thanks to your efforts.  
The next priority issue is securing a cleaner water source.  Drinking from the pond on the 
back end of the ranch has led to an outbreak of dysentery.  As quickly as possible we need to 
improve the sanitary conditions in the camp.  To do so the first step is to dig a well and 
construct stone fireplaces in the barn for the migrants to boil water.  We are going to need 
at least 75 large rocks from you if we hope to accomplish the task before we all get sick.  
After we have them installed you will have free access to them, guaranteed.
If you take a shovel to a pile of rubble you should be able to pull out structural grade stone.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Mining would always be an option if you had the resources.
I appreciate the work you do.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Gather 50 Pipes
dialogue:
To fabricate the well's hand pump and construct components for several other projects we are going to need to find or 
fabricate a number of steel pipes.  Plumbing is a distant possibility for now but some form of irrigation will eventually 
become desirable.  You could assist us with procuring 50 steel pipes, if you so have the chance.
Hopefully we will be able to assign new migrants to help fulfill our needs in the future.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Pipes are used in numerous metal constructions.  Smashing abandoned furniture may provide the material we need.
I appreciate the work you do.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Gather 2 Motors
dialogue:
With the well's completion we are rapidly closing the sustainability gap.  In order to expand 
from here we will need massive quantities of lumber to construct fortifications and new buildings.  
We have already begun work on a manually operated sawmill but we will need two motors to control 
the actual blades.  We were hoping you might be able to secure the motors for us.
Power for the motors will be provided by a salvaged truck battery, you need not bring additional mechanical components.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Mining would always be an option if you had the resources.
I appreciate the work you do.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Gather 150 Bleach
dialogue:
Disease and infection remains a persistent problem among the refugees.  Without dedicated medical 
personnel and facilities I doubt everyone will be willing to stick around when the next outbreak 
happens.  Until we can get a former medic or nurse I'm just going to have to improvise.  
Sterilization would be the first step I imagine.  Bring me five gallons of bleach so we can get 
started.
I'm sure you can find bleach in most homes...
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
If you can't find a large supply I'd recommend checking hospitals or research labs.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Collect 100 Aspirin
dialogue:
I've got a handful of bandages and a few first aid kits to work with at the moment... in other 
words I'm completely unable to treat most serious medical emergencies.  I'm supposed to have 
priority on any medical supplies that the scavengers bring in but I imagine the black market 
for the stuff will prevent me from ever seeing it.  I could use your help getting a few 
bottles of aspirin to start with.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Aspirin is pretty common in homes and convenience stores.
We'll go through this pretty quickly but it does help.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find a Flu Shot
dialogue:
The doctor has some ideas on how to recreate a vaccination program for the common flu.  If 
you come across an unused flu shot please bring it to me.  We haven't had any fatalities 
from the flu yet but it is only a matter of time until one of the older or younger members 
of the outpost gets a bad case.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Hospitals or clinics might have a few that haven't been used.
Do you have the flu shot?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 10 Syringes
dialogue:
We are starting to isolate a few natural antibiotic serums but we don't have the supplies to 
administer the cocktails.  I need you to bring me 10 empty syringes to use.  I'll take care of 
cleaning them to prevent transferring infections.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Hospitals or clinics might have a few sitting around.
Do you have the empty syringes?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Collect 3 Hotplates
dialogue:
I was given a few bottles of bleach when I arrived but I need a number of hotplates to actually 
sterilize equipment.  I'm sure you can find them in any old house or appliance store.  Three 
should be enough for now.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
It should be a fairly common item, don't know what else to say.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Collect 200 Multivitamin Pills
dialogue:
Disease is spreading rapidly due to poor nutrition and there is little that I can do about 
it.  With food being scarce, people are willing to survive on whatever they can.  I need 
to start supplementing the outpost's diet with vitamins to prevent potential deaths 
indirectly attributable to nutrition.  I know it is a lot but if you could bring me 200 
multivitamin pills I'd be able to treat the most vulnerable before they spread 
anything to the rest of us.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
It should be a fairly common item, don't know what else to say.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Make 4 Charcoal Purifiers
dialogue:
Despite my recommendations, we continue to have travelers come in with illnesses I've been 
able to trace back to contaminated drinking water.  When boiling water isn't an option they 
need some form of charcoal water filter that they can use.  If you could build me four 
charcoal water filters I'll distribute them to groups as they pass through.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
With some basic survival and crafting skills you should be able to make them with little effort.
Do you have the charcoal water filters?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find a Chemistry Sets
dialogue:
I've been working on producing some of our own medical supplies but I'm going to need a chemistry 
set to get everything that I need in order.  Is there any way you could go through one of the 
school chemistry labs and steal me a chemistry set?
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
You might be able to find one in a pharmacy if you can't find a school.
Do you have the chemistry set?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 10 Filter Masks
dialogue:
The number of airway infections that I've encountered in the past week has depleted my supply of 
masks.  Could you find me 10 filter masks?  I tend to only distribute them in severe cases so 
I'll be sure to make them last.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
You may be able to make one if you had the right guide.
Do you have the filter masks?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 4 Pairs of Rubber Gloves
dialogue:
The bodily fluids that I often have to clean up and the caustic chemicals I deal with have done 
a number on my current pair of gloves.  Could you find me four pairs of heavy rubber gloves?  
That should be enough that I can task a few laborers with cleanup details in the event of an 
outbreak.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
You should be able to find them in cleaning closets.
Do you have the rubber gloves?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find 2 Scalpels
dialogue:
I heard that we may have a physician on his way here.  The workers have already begun expanding 
the clinic but I need you to locate a pair of scalpels to use in surgery when he arrives.  
I'm sure you should be able to find them in a hospital or craft shop.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Hospitals and crafting stores should have a few.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Find Advanced Emergency Care
dialogue:
Have you heard of a book called the 'Guide to Advanced Emergency Care?'  I really need a copy.  
The doctor is requesting a lot of supplies that I'm not familiar with but I believe I could 
make if I could get a copy of the book.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Libraries are the only place I'd think to look.
Do you have the Guide to Advanced Emergency Care?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Make 12 Knife Spears
dialogue:
I can usually use additional survival gear to kit-out the new recruits.  The most basic weapon 
that everyone gets is the knife spear... it provides a good mix of range, power, and ease of 
use when engaging the more common monsters.  Could you make me a dozen of them?  I may need 
more later but that should help the first few teams.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
You should be able to make them with the most basic of skills.
Do you have the knife spears?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Make 5 Wearable Flashlights
dialogue:
Night is the ideal time for my team to go on raids but they are going to need better light 
sources to speed up their missions.  Could you craft a set of five head torches for 
them?  Keeping both hands free greatly helps during combat.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
You should be able to make them with the most basic of skills.
Do you have the wearable flashlights?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Make 3 Leather Body Armor
dialogue:
Clothing that can withstand the wear and tear of climbing through windows and fighting back 
wild animals is in high demand.  The best that we have been able to field is leather body 
armor but it is difficult to make with our limited resources.  Could you craft us three 
pairs of leather body armor?  The life-expectancy of my scavengers would drastically increase 
if you did.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Finding the leather might be easier in town rather than making it yourself.
Do you have the leather armor?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Make 12 Molotov Cocktails
dialogue:
When outnumbered or forced to pull back my scavengers have been taught to throw Molotov cocktails 
to keep monsters from chasing them.  We go through one or two on every mission so we can always 
use a few more.  Would you be willing to make us a dozen?  I'm willing to pay you what I can for 
your assistance.
Come back when you get a chance, we need skilled survivors.
Alcohol or lamp oil is probably easier to refine rather than find in large quantities.
Do you have the Molotov cocktails?
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Reach Farm House
dialogue: I just need a place to start over...

I've accepted that everyone I used to know is dead... one way or another.  I 
really wish I could have done something to save my brother but he was one of the first to go. 
I'd like to start over, just rebuild at one of the farms in the countryside.  Can you help me 
secure one?
Thank you, let's find a remote one so we don't have to worry about many zombies.
Please, I just don't know what to do otherwise.
Traveling the backroads would be a good way to search for one.
Shall we keep looking for a farm house?

Well, my adventuring days are over.  I can't thank you enough.  Trying to make 
this place self sustaining will take some work but the future is looking brighter.  At least it 
ought to be safe for now.  You'll always be welcome here.
I guess it was just a pipe dream.

name: Reach FEMA Camp
dialogue: Maybe they escaped to one of the camps...

I can't thank you enough for bringing me the patient records but I do have 
another request.  You seem to know your way around... could you take me to one of the 
FEMA camps?  I know some were overrun but I don't want to believe all of them could have 
fallen.
Thank you, just bring me to the camp... I just want to see.
Please, I don't know what else to do.
We should go at night, if it is overrun then we can quickly make our escape.
Any leads on where a camp might be?
I guess this wasn't as bright an idea as I thought.
I bet some of them are still out there...

name: Reach Safety
dialogue: YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG
YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THIS, THIS IS A BUG

name: Recover Priest's Diary
dialogue: St. Michael the archangel defend me in battle...

From what I understand, the creatures you encountered 
surrounding this relic were unlike anything I've heard of.  It is 
laughable that I now consider the living dead to be part of our 
ordinary reality.  Never-the-less, the church must have some explanation 
for these events.  I have located the residence of a local clergy man, 
could you go to this address and recover any items that may reveal what 
the church's stance is on these events?
I wish you the best of luck, may whatever god you please guide your path.
Ya, I guess the stress may just be getting to me...

If the information is confidential the priest must have it hidden 
within his own home.
Thank you, a diary is exactly what I was looking for.
What good does this do us?
It was a lost cause anyways...

name: Recruit Tracker
dialogue: You seem to know this new world better than most...

We've got another problem to deal with but I don't think we can handle 
it on our own.  So, I sent word out and found us a volunteer... of sorts.  He's vain 
as hell but has a little skill with firearms.  He was supposed to collect whatever he 
had of value and is going to meet us at a cabin in the woods.  Wasn't sure how long 
we were going to be so I told him to just camp there until we picked him up.

Rodger, if he's a no-show then any other gunslinger will do... but I doubt he'll quit 
before we even begin.

Hey, I know I wouldn't volunteer for it either... but then I remember that most of us survivors 
won't make it unless someone decides to take the initiative.

I hope the bastard is packing heat... else we'll need to grab him a gun before we hit our next 
target.
Great, just let me know when you are ready to wade knee-deep in an ocean of blood.

name: Find Lost Dog
dialogue: I left my poor dog in a house, not far from here.  Can you retrieve it?
Please, think of my poor little puppy!

Take my dog whistle; if the dog starts running off, blow it and he'll return 
to your side.
Have you found my dog yet?
Thank you so much for finding him!
What?!  You're lying, I can tell!  Ugh, forget it!
